result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick A. Nowak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.02(1)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Graffiti, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.017(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs AFTER serving 30 months.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay restitution to the victims.  Court will refer this to Court Commissioner.  To be done within 60 days of referral.  Within 30 days after that, Court will determine amount of restitution and incorporate it into the sentence imposed.  May be recorded with audio recorder.    
25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

**2/19/15 - Restitution determined to be Joint & Several with Brian McLeod in 14CF113:  $45,102.00 to Kevin Johnson & $7,500.00 to Acuity Insurance.

**Pay restitution of $316.50 to Kimberly Siclovan for 13CM546. (Not joint & several)

Obtain and maintain full time employment.
May attend school part time as long as the defendant is working full time.
Follow up with all After Care treatment regarding AODA treatment.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.

All prescriptions to come from the same pharmacy. 
Sign all necessary releases so agent can monitor prescription usage. 
Complete the Cognitive Intervention Group.
Comply with other conditions as recommended by the agent. 
Submit DNA sample.  Court will not order the DNA surcharge.

973.20(13)c4 Restitution Hearing Findings of Fact, Conclusions of Law and Judgment

Attorney  Edmund Jelinski appeared by phone for Defendant Brian J. Mcleod. Prosecuting Atty Cass W Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Brian J. Mcleod appeared by phone.  Barbie Muetzel appears by phone.  Kevin Johnson appears via phone.  Attorney Jared Barkley appears in person.

FTR:  10:37a.m.
Restitution hearing on January 22, 2015 at 10:00 am.
943.20(13)(c)4  Referral to Court Commissioner for Restitution Hearing

Defendant Patrick A. Nowak in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. Defendant Patrick A. Nowak in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 13CM-546, 14CF-114 and 14CM-66.

Exhibit #1 is marked on behalf of the Defense prior to the start of Court.

1:31 PM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

Court did order a PSI in 14CF-114.
Atty Cousins received a copy, no corrections from a factual standpoint.
Atty Barkley received a copy, reviewed the report over the phone with his client, addresses one minor correction and one major correction.

State has complied with victim notification statutes.
State provided a copy of the impact statements to the Court and to Defense, does not anticipate victims making a statement today.

Atty Barkley was handed a restitution statement, will be requesting a restitution hearing.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court prior to sentencing, requests prison and jail.
Atty Barkley addresses the Court prior to sentencing, requests probation and jail.
Atty Barkley refers to Exhibit #1.

Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing, a prison sentence must be imposed.

Court will not order DNA surcharge

Extended Supervision for 3 Years

13CM-546:

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on December 19, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Patrick A Nowak in court with attorney Jerod Albert Barkley. Defendant Patrick A Nowak in custody. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF114, 13CM546, 14CM66

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 

14CF114 Counts 1, 2, 5 - NO CONTEST
14CM66 Count 1 - NO CONTEST
13CM546 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 14CF114 Counts 1, 2 & 5, 14CM66 Count 1 and 13CM546.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Dismissed and read-in is 14CF114 Counts 3 & 4, 14CM66 Count 2. 
Court orders a PSI.
PSI to be completed by 12/3/14 with copies forwarded to counsel to prepare for sentencing arguments. 
Bond is revoked.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 19, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

If Bond is posted, would require Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  7****

Court calls case at 10:08 a.m. Attorney Jerod Albert Barkley in court. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Patrick A. Nowak appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Cass Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin. Motion for Bond Modification and Motion for Atty Withdrawal to be heard today.  
Court questions Atty Barkley if and when he filed his Motion for Bond Modifiction.  Atty Barkley states he has filed it via mail and via email to the DA office as wasnt enough time via mail.
Court notes Motion is not in the file.
Court reads the April 8, 2014 letter from Defendant requesting new counsel.  Defendant changes his mind and wants Atty Barkley to represent, now.
Atty Barkley Motion for Bond reduction:  Defendant able to post $500 today and sign a $50 per week wage assignment with his HVAC employer.  Would be living father and step mother. 
ADA Cousins states the victim could not be present today and is opposed to any reduction requested and request the bond remain the same.

BTC: **********************************Bond Modifications
Added Condition to bond:  No direct or indirect contact with Kevin Johnson. If Bond is posted, would require Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  7

Motion to Modification of Bond as to the Reduction is denied.
